II. Purpose of Addendum
The purpose of this addendum is to modify the terms of the child placing agency
license, to include independent living.
III. Methodology
07/21/05 Contact – face to face. Reviewed program statements and
descriptions, policies and procedures for the independent living
program, interviewed Chief Operative Officer, Vice President of
Placement Services, and Quality Assurance Coordinator.
07/21/05 Modify terms of license.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
On 07/21/05 the Chief Operating Officer, Vice President of Placement Services, and
the Quality Assurance Coordinator were interviewed on-site. The program
statements and descriptions, policies and procedures, and documentation formats
for the independent living program were reviewed on-site. The Chief Operating
Officer stated that the rationale for adding an independent living program to the
agency is to ensure the agency’s ability to provide a continuum of care to the
children who are already serviced by the agency in foster care; who may become in
need of independent living services; rather than referring those children elsewhere
for services. The agency will begin implementing independent living services for
children in need of those who are currently being serviced by the agency in foster
care; however may eventually accept referrals from outside entities to service
children in this program. The program statement, policies and procedures,
documentation formats were found to be in compliance with all applicable licensing
rules and statutes. The independent living program will be supervised by a single
social services worker, who will report to a social services supervisor. A case record
for children being serviced through this program will be kept separate from the foster
care case record. The assigned social services worker will be responsible for
providing inspection of the proposed independent living placement, providing the
child and provider with applicable program information and agreements, assisting
the child in developing and maintaining a monthly monetary budget, visiting the child
monthly at the placement; and in providing continued services to the child to assist
with job placement, education, medical needs, etc. The assigned social services
worker and supervisor will be responsible for assessing the appropriateness of
placement of a referred child into the independent living program; along with the
child’s potential to succeed in such a program, the child’s need for supervision, and
the appropriateness of the proposed placement, i.e. provider home, shared
apartment, etc.
2

V. Recommendation
Recommendation is made to continue the regular license, with modification of the
terms to add supervision of independent living.
